headline: Deputy Special Agent in Charge at Homeland Security Investigations

defaultPosition.description:
â¢	Deputy Special Agent in Charge for Homeland Security Investigations (HSI)
â¢	Manage HSIâs personnel and mission within the HSI Laredo area of responsibility to include over 200 Special Agents and over 270 total staff.
â¢	The area of responsibility spans from Laredo, Texas to the Gulf of Mexico, covering ten (10) counties, hundreds of miles of international border between the U.S. and Mexico and is one of the most operationally active areas in the Agency.
â¢	Provide planning, organization, administration and coordination of HSI activities throughout the area of jurisdiction which are broad in scope and extremely complex in nature 
â¢	Manage and direct the work of the organizational unit within the AOR 
â¢	Establish action plans, goals, and objectives that comport with HSI headquarters management directives and goals
â¢	Ensure the success of the HSI program, monitor progress toward strategic HSI goals, evaluate performance, and take action to improve performance with the AOR
â¢	Manage a complex investigative program focusing on the broad array of federal law enforcement investigative authorities; national security, financial crimes, illegal arms exports, commercial fraud, alien smuggling, human trafficking, narcotics smuggling, cybercrimes, child pornography/exploitation, and immigration fraud

positions.title: Supervisory Special Agent

positions.description:
â¢	Unit Chief - Technical Collection Unit, Homeland Security Investigations (HSI) - Office of Intelligence  
â¢	Managed a unit that identified intelligence needs pertaining to the U.S. Southwest border region in line with ICE Standard Information Needs and the ICE Strategic Plan
â¢	Managed the intelligence activities of the program through subordinate supervisors who supervise staff involved in intelligence gathering functions

positions.title: Supervisory Special Agent - Unit Chief

positions.description:
â¢	Chief of Staff - ICE Enforcement and Removal Operations (ERO)
â¢	Provided expert executive management of the complex ERO program and expert advisory services regarding all phases of the programs responsibilities
â¢	Advised program management in refining missions, developing key result areas, measuring high priority performance goals, and enabling ERO to exceed goals in all program areas including enforcement, detention, removal, health service, mission support, and field operations  
â¢	Developed, coordinated, and implemented strategic plans to include mission goals, objectives, and implementation strategies for all programs within ERO  
â¢	Served as the Chief of Staff during the Presidential transition, which required extensive writing and briefing to the Presidential Transition Team, DHS Secretary, ICE Director, and supporting staffs
positions.title: Supervisory Detention and Deportation Officer - Chief of Staff
